intro: Agoseris grandiflora var. grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered agoseris, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces showy yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Agoseris grandiflora var. grandiflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to pollinators.
